body: It should be called 'Getting Started Guide'.
One minor comment + don't see any unit-tests but otherwise LGTM.
Is it feasible to use try-with-resources (https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html) in such cases?

@ashvina adding my input but open to hearing what others think. 

I was also pondering the same however for multiple resources it felt like the construct would lead to compromising code readability. I lean towards code readability over the convenience of AutoCloseable resources.
@maosongfu thanks for considering the logging improvements. Added one comment, not necessarily related to this change just for clarification. But this looks good.

"A minor typo in the log message: Existing should be Exiting?" is fixed in: #177 
Exception catching will be handled soon.
Apart from minor nits, it looks good. Merge after fixing them.

@ashvina By design SchedulerMain is supposed to be run as a separate process, in which case you wouldn't have access to any of its methods once launched. Are you trying to use SchedulerMain as a library?

I am running Scheduler as a separate process. The JVM will run the Scheduler component only and no other Heron component. However instead of invoking the scheduler as a shell/java command, I am invoking the main method directly from a "handle" I receive from the cluster/resource manager.

@ashvina So I am guessing you have a separate main program that want to launch scheduler in the same process, is that correct? I guess we could make it more flexible for such cases to use Scheduler as a library, instead of going through main method. Let me know if that is what you are looking for.
Ok cool, I have assigned it to myself. Will keep this issue posted as I make progress
bundled into two jars - heron-api.jar and heron-storm.jar (contains storm-compat and localmode jars). Fixed in #223

Updates:
1. Uniform the scheduler abstraction: run NullScheduler (a dummy scheduler) in Aurora implementation
2. Include NullLauncher and NullScheduler into building target.
3. Uniform the path for activate/deactivate request.
4. Remove unnecessary config.

git clone <heron-repo>
git checkout -b prabhu/heron
./bazel-configure.py
cd scripts
./setup-intellij.sh

This is great. I will look at it in the night.

Sent from my iPhone

addressed the bazel build and other stylistic issues. also added support for python module in the intellij workspace.  I think i might have messed up the whitespaces with the latest commit so , the diff doesnt appear to be clean. Please advice.
Yeah I met this issue a lot. And the workaround I did is to install them manually.

Hi,

Simply saying, the topology is running fine. Congratulations!

The failure metric is a bit different from exceptions/errors; it is increased when topology invokes collector.fail(tuple) explicitly or timeout.

The topology you running, AckingTopology, https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/examples/src/java/com/twitter/heron/examples/AckingTopology.java#L87, will report failure via collector.fail(tuple) explicitly for half tuples. So the metric in fact is showing the expected running status.

@kramasamy Should we use another sample topology in getting started documentation to avoid confusion? For instance, the ExclamationTopology

It should be under the directory ~/.m2/repository/com/twitter/heron/

```
ls -l ~/.m2/repository/com/twitter/heron/
```

Integrated test done.
Unit tests will be added once enabling all unit tests for scheduler.
Fixed in #128 where all the jars in lib/ directory organized by their directories.

Files changes include some of the commits that we did. I would suggest do the following - 

```
git clone <heron-master-repo>
git checkout -b prabhu/intellj

<include your changes>

git commit -am <your message>
git push origin prabhu/intellij
```

Once the branch is pushed, please create a pull request. We are verifying it and soon you will get som e feedback.

sorry, i didnt realize that some of the changes were commited earlier.
I will fork from master again and include just my changes.
started working on the kubernetes scheduler in my earlier branch. I will
move that out as well.

Thanks
prabhu
